intro: Helipterum stoveae, commonly known as the Stove's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it has narrow, grass-like leaves. Helipterum stoveae is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
